info.description: Textile Node Local REST API Documentation
info.title: Textile Node API

get.description: Shows the local node's account address

post.description: Shows all known account peers

parameters.description: wait: Stops searching after 'wait' seconds have elapsed (max 10s), events: Whether to emit Server-Sent Events (SSEvent) or plain JSON
parameters.name: X-Textile-Opts

get.description: Shows all known account peers

Paginates blocks in a thread. Blocks are the raw components in a thread.
Think of them as an append-only log of thread updates where each update is
hash-linked to its parent(s). New / recovering peers can sync history by simply
traversing the hash tree.

parameters.description: thread: Thread ID (can also use 'default'), offset: Offset ID to start listing from (omit for latest), limit: List page size (default: 5)
parameters.name: X-Textile-Opts

get.description: Gets a thread block by ID

delete.description: Removes a thread block by ID

get.description: Gets a thread comment by block ID
Lists comments on a thread block

post.description: Adds a comment to a thread block

get.description: Gets a thread like by block ID
Lists likes on a thread block

post.description: Adds a like to a thread block

get.description:
List info about all active cafe sessions. Cafes are other peers on the network
who offer pinning, backup, and inbox services
get.summary: List info about all active cafe sessions

post.description:
Registers with a cafe and saves an expiring service session token. An access
token is required to register, and should be obtained separately from the target
Cafe

parameters.description: token: An access token supplied by the Cafe
parameters.name: X-Textile-Opts

post.description:
Check for messages at all cafes. New messages are downloaded and processed
opportunistically.
post.summary: Check for messages at all cafes

get.description:
Gets and displays info about a cafe session. Cafes are other peers on the network
who offer pinning, backup, and inbox services
get.summary: Gets and displays info about a cafe session

delete.description: Deregisters with a cafe (content will expire based on the cafe's service rules)

put.description:
Replace entire config file contents. The config command controls configuration
variables. It works much like 'git config'. The configuration values are stored
in a config file inside the Textile repository.

patch.description:
When patching config values, valid JSON types must be used. For example, a string
should be escaped or wrapped in single quotes (e.g., \"127.0.0.1:40600\") and
arrays and objects work fine (e.g. '{"API": "127.0.0.1:40600"}') but should be
wrapped in single quotes. Be sure to restart the daemon for changes to take effect.
See https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6902 for details on RFC6902 JSON patch format.

parameters.description: An RFC6902 JSON patch (array of ops)
parameters.name: patch

get.description:
Report the currently active config settings, which may differ from the values
specifed when setting/patching values.
Lists all, or thread-based, contacts.

parameters.description: thread: Thread ID (omit for all known contacts)
parameters.name: X-Textile-Opts

post.description: Search for contacts known locally and on the network

parameters.description: local: Whether to only search local contacts, limit: Stops searching after limit results are found, wait: Stops searching after 'wait' seconds have elapsed (max 10s), username: search by username string, peer: search by peer id string, address: search by account address string, events: Whether to emit Server-Sent Events (SSEvent) or plain JSON
parameters.name: X-Textile-Opts

get.description: Gets information about a known contact

put.description:
Adds a contact to list of known local contacts. A common workflow is to pipe
/contact/search results into this endpoint, just be sure you know what the results
of the search are before adding!

get.description:
Paginates post (join|leave|files|message) and annotation (comment|like) block types
The mode option dictates how the feed is displayed:
"chrono": All feed block types are shown. Annotations always nest their target post,
i.e., the post a comment is about.
"annotated": Annotations are nested under post targets, but are not shown in the
top-level feed.
"stacks": Related blocks are chronologically grouped into "stacks". A new stack is
started if an unrelated block breaks continuity. This mode is used by Textile
Photos. Stacks may include:
* The initial post with some nested annotations. Newer annotations may have already
been listed.
* One or more annotations about a post. The newest annotation assumes the "top"
position in the stack. Additional annotations are nested under the target.
Newer annotations may have already been listed in the case as well.
get.summary: Paginates post and annotation block types

parameters.description: thread: Thread ID (can also use 'default'), offset: Offset ID to start listing from (omit for latest), limit: List page size (default: 5), mode: Feed mode (one of 'chrono', 'annotated', or 'stacks')
parameters.name: X-Textile-Opts

get.description:
Paginates thread files. If thread id not provided, paginate all files. Specify
"default" to use the default thread (if set).

parameters.description: thread: Thread ID. Omit for all, offset: Offset ID to start listing from. Omit for latest, limit: List page size. (default: 5)
parameters.name: X-Textile-Opts

get.description: Gets a thread file by block ID
Lists all pending thread invites

post.description: Creates a direct peer-to-peer or external invite to a thread
post.summary: Create an invite to a thread

parameters.description: thread: Thread ID (can also use 'default'), peer: Peer ID (omit to create an external invite)
parameters.name: X-Textile-Opts

post.description:
Accepts a direct peer-to-peer or external invite to a thread. Use the key option
with an external invite

parameters.description: key: key for an external invite
parameters.name: X-Textile-Opts

post.description: Ignores a direct peer-to-peer invite to a thread

get.description: Displays the data behind an IPFS CID (hash)

parameters.description: key: Key to decrypt data on-the-fly
parameters.name: X-Textile-Opts

get.description: Displays underlying IPFS peer ID

post.description: Opens a new direct connection to a peer using an IPFS multiaddr
post.summary: Opens a new direct connection to a peer address

get.description: Lists the set of peers this node is connected to

parameters.description: verbose: Display all extra information, latency: Also list information about latency to each peer, streams: Also list information about open streams for each peer, direction: Also list information about the direction of connection
parameters.name: X-Textile-Opts

get.description: Shows file keys under the given target from an add

post.description:
List or change the verbosity of one or all subsystems log output. Textile logs
piggyback on the IPFS event logs

parameters.description: level: Log-level (one of: debug, info, warning, error, critical, or
parameters.name: X-Textile-Opts

get.description: Paginates thread messages

parameters.description: thread: Thread ID (can also use 'default', omit for all), offset: Offset ID to start listing from (omit for latest), limit: List page size (default: 5)
parameters.name: X-Textile-Opts

get.description: Gets a thread message by block ID

post.description:
Takes a binary data blob, and optionally encrypts it, before adding to IPFS,
and returns a file object

parameters.description: plaintext: whether to leave unencrypted), use: if empty, assumes body contains multipart form file data, otherwise, will attempt to fetch given CID from IPFS
parameters.name: X-Textile-Opts

post.description:
Takes an input image, and extracts its EXIF data (optionally encrypting output),
before adding to IPFS, and returns a file object

parameters.description: plaintext: whether to leave unencrypted, use: if empty, assumes body contains multipart form file data, otherwise, will attempt to fetch given CID from IPFS
parameters.name: X-Textile-Opts

post.description:
Takes an input image, and resizes/resamples it (optionally encrypting output),
before adding to IPFS, and returns a file object

parameters.description: plaintext: whether to leave unencrypted, use: if empty, assumes body contains multipart form file data, otherwise, will attempt to fetch given CID from IPFS, width: the requested image width (required), quality: the requested JPEG image quality
parameters.name: X-Textile-Opts

post.description:
Takes an input JSON document, validates it according to its schema.org definition,
optionally encrypts the output before adding to IPFS, and returns a file object

parameters.description: plaintext: whether to leave unencrypted, use: if empty, assumes body contains multipart form file data, otherwise, will attempt to fetch given CID from IPFS
parameters.name: X-Textile-Opts

post.description: Takes a JSON-based Schema, validates it, adds it to IPFS, and returns a file object
post.summary: Validate, add, and pin a new Schema

get.description: Lists all notifications generated by thread and account activity.

post.description: Marks a notifiction as read by ID. Use 'all' to mark all as read.

get.description: Pings another peer on the network, returning online|offline.
Gets the local node's public profile

post.description: Sets public profile avatar by specifying an existing image file hash
Sets public profile username to given string

get.description:
Subscribes to updates in a thread or all threads. An update is generated
when a new block is added to a thread. There are several update types:
JOIN, ANNOUNCE, LEAVE, MESSAGE, FILES, COMMENT, LIKE, MERGE, IGNORE, FLAG

parameters.description: thread id, omit to stream all events
parameters.name: id

parameters.description: type: Or'd list of event types (e.g., FILES|COMMENTS|LIKES) or empty to include all types, events: Whether to emit Server-Sent Events (SSEvent) or plain JSON
parameters.name: X-Textile-Opts

get.description: Lists all local threads, returning a ThreadList object

post.description:
Adds a new Thread with given name, type, and sharing and members options, returning
a Thread object
post.summary: Adds and joins a new thread

parameters.description: key: A locally unique key used by an app to identify this thread on recovery, schema: Existing Thread Schema IPFS CID, type: Set the thread type to one of 'private', 'read_only', 'public', or 'open', sharing: Set the thread sharing style to one of 'not_shared','invite_only', or 'shared', members: An array of contact addresses. When supplied, the thread will not allow additional peers beyond those in array, useful for 1-1 chat/file sharing
parameters.name: X-Textile-Opts

get.description: Gets and displays info about a thread

put.description: Adds or updates a thread directly, usually from a backup
put.summary: Add or update a thread directly

post.description:
Adds a file or directory of files to a thread. Files not supported by the thread
schema are ignored. Nested directories are included. An existing file hash may
also be used as input.
post.summary: Adds a file or directory of files to a thread

parameters.description: caption: Caption to add to file(s)
parameters.name: X-Textile-Opts

post.description: Adds a message to a thread

get.description: Lists all peers in a thread, optionally listing peers in the default thread
List info about all stored cafe tokens

post.description:
Generates an access token (44 random bytes) and saves a bcrypt hashed version for
future lookup. The response contains a base58 encoded version of the random bytes
token. If the 'store' option is set to false, the token is generated, but not
stored in the local Cafe db. Alternatively, an existing token can be added using
by specifying the 'token' option.
Tokens allow other peers to register with a Cafe peer.

parameters.description: token: Use existing token, rather than creating a new one, store: Whether to store the added/generated token to the local db
parameters.name: X-Textile-Opts

get.description: Check validity of existing cafe access token
